forum.name: suggestions
forum.description: got a new feature idea for anyland, or anything that could be improved?
forum.latestCommentText: i wonder if the game can actually handle that many script lines.

thread.title: using shapes to cut pieces of other shapes i.e. a spherical hole in a cube

comments.text: this feature would make building worlds much easier such as using it to make buildings or to show progress while eating an apple. if this is already a thing, i would love to know.
code savy people will say this beter, but having a tool that adds more vertices would cause more problems, i'd say you're better off making an apple with several consumable shapes.
well, i was mainly wanting it to be ble to makea large buildikng without having to create each wal in dividually and being able to cut ouit windows and doors
i was thinking it could just be a material to make a shape cut or i would even be happy if the vertex editor had a snip function
its called booleans in 3d modeling, and yes phillip knows all about it, as it was a request when the game was first made, but the processing cost is too high & would slow the game

thread.latestCommentText: its called booleans in 3d modeling, and yes phillip knows all about it, as it was a request when the game was first made, but the processing cost is too high & would slow the game
